penguinoamante2 writes:
> Find all the pages that have "mailto", "contact", or that match the
> regular expression "(\d\d\d)\d\d\d-\d\d\d\d".  

I am writing a C++ library for accessing information in ARC files, and
implementing something like the above would be doable wtih that.

I agree with St.Ack that mining the contents of the ARC file are
out-of-scope of Heretrix though.

> Also there is a jakarta project called
> (http://jakarta.apache.org/lucene/docs/index.html).  Is that something
> to use to create an index from an ARC file?

Not without some work. Lucene is a search engine that does its own
crawling. You could certainly modify it to do its magic over a
collection of ARC files, I guess, but it would require some surgery.

    -tree
